roles.name: Food Safety Inspector
roles.description: Examines food production, processing, and handling facilities to ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations.

meta.typicalBackground: Public health or food science degree, training in HACCP or ISO 22000, strong attention to detail
challenges: Enforcing strict standards in diverse operations, addressing supply chain traceability, language or cultural barriers at sites

sampleUseCase.scenario: An inspector audits a meat processing plant, discovers inadequate sanitization procedures, and mandates corrective actions to prevent contamination.

roles.name: Nutritionist
roles.description: Develops dietary recommendations, ensuring balanced meal plans for various populations or product formulations in food industry settings.

meta.typicalBackground: Degree in nutrition or dietetics, often registered/licensed, strong knowledge of human physiology
challenges: Tailoring advice to cultural food preferences, managing misinformation, aligning cost/availability with nutrition goals

sampleUseCase.scenario: A nutritionist partners with a school lunch program to craft menus that reduce sugar intake by 30% and increase fruits/vegetables, improving student health outcomes.

roles.name: Culinary Innovator
roles.description: Combines cooking expertise with creativity to develop new recipes or products, often aligning with health trends or specialized diets.

meta.typicalBackground: Culinary arts training, experimentation mindset, understanding of flavor profiles
challenges: Balancing taste, cost, nutritional guidelines, consumer expectations of novelty

sampleUseCase.scenario: A culinary innovator at a plant-based startup develops a new vegan cheese alternative, taste-testing prototypes until achieving a realistic texture and flavor that wins a major retailerâ€™s listing.

roles.name: Food Supply Coordinator
roles.description: Manages logistics from farm to processing and retail, ensuring timely delivery of raw materials or finished goods.

meta.typicalBackground: Supply chain or food operations experience, understanding of perishability and cold chain requirements
challenges: Short shelf-life, temperature-sensitive distribution, forecasting demand volatility

sampleUseCase.scenario: A coordinator arranges a just-in-time delivery of lettuce from nearby farms to a salad packaging facility, reducing waste from spoilage and meeting grocery store restock timelines.

roles.name: Restaurant Manager
roles.description: Oversees daily operations of a dining establishment, handling staff, inventory, customer experience, and financial performance.

meta.typicalBackground: Hospitality or business degree, strong leadership and customer service orientation
challenges: Maintaining consistent food quality, staff turnover, cost control for ingredients and overhead

sampleUseCase.scenario: The manager revamps the menu using local seasonal produce, negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers, and introduces weekly specials, boosting both profit margin and customer satisfaction.
